00020 
00021 ///Arcball sphere constants:
00022 ///Diameter is       2.0f
00023 ///Radius is         1.0f
00024 ///Radius squared is 1.0f
00025 
00026 /**
00027 Map point ot sphere
00028 */
00029 void ArcBall_t::_mapToSphere(Point2fT^ NewPt, Vector3fT^ NewVec)
00030 {
00031     Point2fT^ TempPt=gcnew Point2fT() ;
00032     GLfloat length;
00033 
00034     //Copy paramter into temp point
00035         TempPt ->X = NewPt->X;
00036     TempPt ->Y = NewPt->Y;
00037 
00038     //Adjust point coords and scale down to range of [-1 ... 1]
00039     TempPt->X  =        (TempPt->X * this->AdjustWidth)  - 1.0f;
00040     TempPt->Y  = 1.0f - (TempPt->Y * this->AdjustHeight);
00041 
00042     //Compute the square of the length of the vector to the point from the center
00043     length      = (TempPt->X * TempPt->X) + (TempPt->Y * TempPt->Y);
00044 
00045     //If the point is mapped outside of the sphere... (length > radius squared)
00046     if (length > 1.0f)
00047     {
00048         GLfloat norm;
00049 
00050         //Compute a normalizing factor (radius / sqrt(length))
00051         norm    = 1.0f / Funcsqrt(length);
00052 
00053         //Return the "normalized" vector, a point on the sphere
00054         NewVec->X = TempPt->X * norm;
00055         NewVec->Y = TempPt->Y * norm;
00056         NewVec->Z = 0.0f;
00057     }
00058     else    //Else it's on the inside
00059     {
00060         //Return a vector to a point mapped inside the sphere sqrt(radius squared - length)
00061         NewVec->X = TempPt->X;
00062         NewVec->Y = TempPt->Y;
00063         NewVec->Z = Funcsqrt(1.0f - length);
00064     }
00065 }
00066 
00067 /**
00068 Create/Destroy
00069 */
00070 ArcBall_t::ArcBall_t(GLfloat NewWidth, GLfloat NewHeight)
00071 {
00072      StVec=gcnew Vector3fT();          //Saved click vector
00073      EnVec=gcnew Vector3fT();  
00074         //Clear initial values
00075     this->StVec->X     =
00076     this->StVec->Y     = 
00077     this->StVec->Z     = 
00078 
00079     this->EnVec->X     =
00080     this->EnVec->Y     = 
00081     this->EnVec->Z     = 0.0f;
00082 
00083     //Set initial bounds
00084     this->setBounds(NewWidth, NewHeight);
00085 }
00086 
00087 /**
00088 Mouse down
00089 */
00090 void    ArcBall_t::click(Point2fT^ NewPt)
00091 {
00092     //Map the point to the sphere
00093     this->_mapToSphere(NewPt, this->StVec);
00094 }
00095 
00096 /**
00097 Mouse drag, calculate rotation
00098 */
00099 void    ArcBall_t::drag(Point2fT^ NewPt, Quat4fT^ NewRot)
00100 {
00101     //Map the point to the sphere
00102         this->_mapToSphere(NewPt, this->EnVec);
00103         
00104         
00105 
00106     //Return the quaternion equivalent to the rotation
00107     if (NewRot)
00108     {
00109         Vector3fT^  Perp=gcnew Vector3fT();
00110 
00111         //Compute the vector perpendicular to the begin and end vectors
00112         Vector3fCross(Perp, this->StVec, this->EnVec);
00113 
00114         //Compute the length of the perpendicular vector            
00115         if (Vector3fLength(Perp) > Epsilon)    //if its non-zero
00116         {
00117             //We're ok, so return the perpendicular vector as the transform after all
00118             NewRot->X = Perp->X;
00119             NewRot->Y = Perp->Y;
00120             NewRot->Z = Perp->Z;
00121             //In the quaternion values, w is cosine (theta / 2), where theta is rotation angle
00122             NewRot->W= Vector3fDot(this->StVec, this->EnVec);
00123         }
00124         else                                    //if its zero
00125         {
00126             //The begin and end vectors coincide, so return an identity transform
00127             NewRot->X = 
00128             NewRot->Y = 
00129             NewRot->Z = 
00130             NewRot->W = 0.0f;
00131         }
00132     }
00133 }
